techmeme.title: A Holdings Corp., a holding company owned equally by SoftBank and Naver, plans to sell down its stake in LY's ~$1B tender; LY operates Line messaging app (Mayumi Negishi/Bloomberg)
Nintendo reports Q1 revenue down 46.5% YoY to ~$1.65B, vs. ~$1.92B exp., net profit down 55.3% YoY to ~$536M, and Switch sales down 46% YoY to 2.1M units (Arjun Kharpal/CNBC)
Study: a year after Meta blocked news content in Canada due to the Online News Act, Canadians' total engagement with news content on social media is down 43% (The Canadian Press)
Turkey blocks Instagram without stating a reason or the duration; a Turkish official claimed Instagram blocked condolence posts on Ismail Haniyeh's killing (Tuvan Gumrukcu/Reuters)
Sources: Apple in recent months has demanded Tencent and ByteDance close loopholes used by their in-app creators to funnel users to external payment systems (Pei Li/Bloomberg)
